meanings.definition: A person who raises or cares for young children or animals.
meanings.sent1: The dedicated rearer fed the baby animals every few hours.
meanings.sent2: The rearer at the farm ensured all the piglets were healthy and happy.
meanings.sent3: The rearer made sure the little chicks had their own cozy nests.
meanings.sent4: She was a skilled rearer, nurturing the puppies with love and patience.
meanings.sent5: The kind rearer sang lullabies to the kittens to help them sleep peacefully.

meanings.definition: A person who brings up or nurtures something.
meanings.sent1: As a rearer of plants, she carefully watered and pruned each one.
meanings.sent2: The rearer of ideas shared his thoughts with passion and enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The rearer of dreams believed in the power of imagination.
meanings.sent4: She was a rearer of hope, spreading positivity wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The rearer of creativity inspired others with her innovative projects.

meanings.definition: A person who supports or promotes something.
meanings.sent1: The rearer of the cause organized events to raise awareness.
meanings.sent2: As a rearer of charity, he dedicated his time to helping those in need.
meanings.sent3: The rearer of the team cheered loudly from the sidelines.
meanings.sent4: She was a loyal rearer of the local businesses, always recommending them to friends.
meanings.sent5: The rearer of the campaign worked tirelessly to gather support from the community.
